title: dennis_nedry
body:
Dennis Theodore Nedry was the main antagonist during the first half of the original [[Jurassic Park]] film. He was a computer programmer at Jurassic Park. Due to his financial problems and low salary, he accepted a bribe from Biosyn to smuggle [[dinosaur]] embryos off the island.

In both the film and the novel, he is slain by a Dilophosaurus. He was directly responsible for the events that happened in both the novel and film. A combination of factors led to his demise: despite working in a career around dinosaurs and other prehistoric creatures, he had a limited knowledge of them, and greed, which was intertwined by desperation to pay off his debt collectors and make himself rich after that.

title: hagia_sophia
body:
[b]Hagia Sophia[/b] (lit. 'Holy Wisdom'; Ancient Greek: Ἁγία Σοφία (Hagía Sophía), Turkish: Ayasofya), is a [[mosque]] and major cultural and historical site in [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey (country)|Turkey]]. It was erected three times by the Eastern Roman Empire. The present Hagia Sophia is the third, built in 537 AD. It carried several titles over its long history, serving as an Orthodox [[church]] (with a brief period as a Catholic [[cathedral]] due to the Fourth Crusade), a mosque, a [[museum]], and then a mosque again. Though [[Byzantine architecture|Byzantine-made]], it has long since received [[Middle Eastern architecture|Islamic additions]], such as its famous [[minaret]]s.

h1. See also
* [[Tag Group:Locations]]
* [[Tag Group:Real World Locations]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Hagia Sophia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hagia_Sophia

title: istanbul
body:
The largest city in the [[Turkey (country)|Republic of Turkiye]]. Originally known as "Constantinople" before being renamed to its current name in 1930. Served as the capital of the [[Ottoman Empire]] and the [[Byzantine Empire]], with the city being founded as the capital of the Eastern [[Roman Empire]] in 330 AD by [[Constantine the Great]].

Originally sitting only on the Western side of the Straits of Bosporus, the city has long-since spread to be on both sides. Notable landmarks include the [[Hagia Sophia]].

title: yamato_(dishwasher1910)
body:
An umbrella tag for several hypothetical designs for an [[Azur Lane]] version of the battleship [i]Yamato[/i], drawn by [[dishwasher1910]]. In the same line as the Sakura Empire's most powerful capital ships, this Yamato is drawn as a nine-tailed [[fox girl|kitsune]], but the details vary significantly from one concept to the other. In spite of being an unofficial design, many players have taken quite well to her, and hope Yostar and Manjuu would one day properly add her to the game.

title: diabellstar_the_black_witch
body:
A [[Duel Monster]] and the main character of the Sinful Spoil card storyline from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]]. Diabellstar is a treasure hunter who seeks to collect the "Sinful Spoils", sentient magical artifacts with immense power.

She normally has [[pale skin]], [[grey hair]] with [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[red hair|red]] and [[green hair]] on her sides, and [[yellow eyes|yellow-ish]] [[grey eyes]], though her right eye will turn [[green eyes|green]] once she dons her red [[half mask]] and using the power of the "Sinful Spoil". Her body is also noticeably more [[toned female|muscular]] than the other Duel Monster female protagonist, though this detail is often omitted in some fanarts.

Initially introduced as a calm and stoic character, but later cards reveals that she is quite expressive, somewhat hot-headed, and a bit of a drunkard.

h4. See also

* [[Astellar of the White Forest]] (Younger version)
* [[Like the Diabell]] (Teenage version)
other_names: 黒魔女ディアベルスター

title: diabellze_the_original_sinkeeper
body:
A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]]. [[Diabellstar the Black Witch]]'s rival and childhood friend in the Sinful Spoils storyline. In stark contrast to Diabellstar's Dark Spellcaster-Type, Diabellze is a Light Illusion-type Monster.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[purple hair|purple]] hair tips, she wears an all-white [[witch hat]] and tight bodysuit-like outfit with [[asymmetrical_sleeves|no sleeves on her right arm]] to make room for her sinful spoil attached there. She also has a faint [[heterochromia]] with her left eye being [[purple eyes|purple]] while her right were purplish-[[blue eyes|blue]], though this is often [[alternate eye color|omitted in fanarts]] by making both eyes either purple or blue instead.

h4. Variants

* [[Diabellze the White Witch]]
* [[Elzette of the White Forest]] (Younger version)

title: lovely_labrynth_of_the_silver_castle
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 8
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Fiend / Effect
[i]
Your opponent cannot activate monster effects in response to the activation of your Normal Trap Cards. You can only use each of the following effects of "Lovely Labrynth of the Silver Castle" once per turn. You can target 1 Normal Trap in your GY; Set it to your field, but it cannot be activated unless you control a Fiend monster. If another monster(s) leaves the field by your Normal Trap effect (except during the Damage Step): You can destroy 1 card in your opponent's hand (at random) or their field.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 2900
[b]DEF:[/b] 1900


A [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]], a [[demon girl|demoness]] boss monster of the Labrynth archetype. It is hinted that she has some kind of affection for the [[knight (yu-gi-oh!)|nameless knight]] shown in her various artworks.

She is a [[white hair]]-ed [[demon girl]] with large [[demon horns]] and [[grey eyes]]. She has [[twin drills|drill]] [[twintails]], and wears a [[white dress]] with [[armored corset]] and [[leotard]]-like undergarments, exposing her [[cleavage]], [[large breasts]] (often further [[huge breasts|upsized to huge]]), and in her official art, her [[armpits]]. She has [[multiple_wings|two pairs of]] [[demon wings]], one at her back and one [[low wings|at her hips]]. Her weapon of choice is a large labrys.

When she's not battling, she wears a grey [[track suit]].

h4. Variants
* [[Lady Labrynth of the Silver Castle]] - her "boss battle" mode

title: precure_all_stars
body:
An annual [[in-franchise crossover]] movie series which brings in the [[Precure]] characters together, starting from the [[Futari wa Precure]] characters and ending with the [[Mahou Girls Precure!]] characters. Afterwards, new crossover movies only include the three most recent generations to limit the amount of characters, with All Stars returning for the [[anniversary|anniversaries]], replacing that season's standalone movie.

This tag can also be used on generic crossover pictures that include Cures from [[everyone|most or every series]], or include [[Sakagami Ayumi]]/[[Cure Echo]], [[Preme_(precure)|Preme]]/[[Cure Supreme]], [[Puca_(precure)|Puca]]/[[Cure Puca]].

title: ki-sikil_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
The more energetic member of the Live Twins online celebrity duo in the [[duel_monster|Yu-Gi-Oh Official Card Game]]. With the help of [[Lil-la (yu-gi-oh!)|Lil-la]], Ki-sikil steals priceless riches using the data they phished from their online livestreams.

In the [i]Card Game Art Works[/i], it is revealed that that she's having [[yuri|a romantic relationship]] with Lil-la, and she is acquainted with both [[I:P Masquerena]] and [[S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru]].

In both of her forms [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[green eyes]] and a [[tail]].
In her [[Live Twin Ki-sikil|Live Twin]] form she has [[twintails]], [[shorts]], and is wearing a [[cropped vest]].
In her [[Evil Twin Ki-sikil|Evil Twin]] form she has [[glasses]], [[gloves]], [[thigh strap|thigh straps]], [[wings]] and [[large breasts]]

title: amanda_o'neill
body: Character from [[Little Witch Academia]], Amanda O'Neill (アマンダ・オニール, Amanda Onīru?) is one of supporting protagonists of Little Witch Academia who made her debut in the film The Enchanted Parade. She is one of three troublemaking girls alongside Constanze and Jasminka where in her case, guilty in repeatedly sneaking into Luna Nova's storehouses and toying with its security systems for fun. Amanda is also the 16 years old heiress of a magical family of dubious reputation from United States skilled in Flight Magic, having penchant of stealing, and rather quick to start a fight.

body:

While this card is in your GY, if a face-up "Sky Striker Ace" Link Monster you control is destroyed by battle, or leaves the field because of an opponent's card effect: You can Special Summon this card. You can only use each effect of "Sky Striker Ace - Raye" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 1500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1500

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]], and the only Main Deck monster of the Sky Striker series, until the release of [[Sky Striker Ace - Roze]], her rival in the card lore.

Due to her popularity thanks to the lore of her archtype as well as her usage in both casual and competitive scene, she became the first protagonist of [i][[Yu-Gi-Oh! OCG Stories]][/i], a serialized manga about the lore of various Yu-Gi-Oh! duel monsters.

title: hu-li_the_jewel_mikanko
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 3
[b]Attribute:[/b] Wind
[b]Type:[/b] Psychic / Effect
[i]
If this card is not equipped with an Equip Card, you take no damage from battles involving this card. If this card is equipped with an Equip Card, it cannot be destroyed by battle and your opponent takes any battle damage you would have taken from battles involving this card. While you control an Equip Card, your opponent cannot target "Mikanko" cards you control with card effects. If either player equips an Equip Card(s) to this card: You can add 1 "Mikanko" Trap from your Deck to your hand. You can only use this effect of "Hu-Li the Jewel Mikanko" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 0
[b]DEF:[/b] 0

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]], part of the "Mikanko" archetype. Hu-Li the Jewel Mikanko wears a green [[japanese clothes]] and manifesting a [[fox ears]] and [[fox tail|tail]] when empowered. She can controls two [[orb]]s with her wind power and [[folding fan]], which are based on the the Yasakani-no-Magatama. She is the daughter of the Mitama house.

Based on the Card Game Art Works, Hu-Li may appear as ambitious and confident, who seems to be able to accomplish multiple things with ease. But actually, she is a very awkward girl who is terrible at expressing her inner feeling.

title: mr_magical_girl
body:
A Korean dark magical girl manhwa.

Story: 202X.

In the back alleys of Seoul, South Korea… He looked down at the heroes under his feet—the heroes who adorned themselves in a variety of colorful clothes, as if they were K-pop idols on TV. Those heroes? They were crawling beneath him, their gaudy outfits smeared with dirt. That was the true nature of being a hero. He hoped the individuals before him learned that lesson well. It was time to ensure they never forgot it. As a magical girl, he swung his hammer down. This is a bright story. The story of a man reclaiming his light.

title: phantoon
body:
A boss in [[Super Metroid]] and [[Metroid: Other M]]. It is a [[monster|monstrous]] ghost-like extraterrestrial that can phase in and out of existence interdimensionally. It lurked within an ancient [[Chozo]] spaceship that crash landed on Planet Zebes, implying that spaceship to be the current Wrecked Ship where it resides and the cause of its crash.

It's body is similar to that of a cephalopod that has a [[one-eyed|single eyeball]] inside it's mouth full of [[sharp teeth]] and two [[tentacles]] outstretched on each side. It's attacks foes with [[blue_fire|blue]] [[fireball]]s that resemble [[hitodama]]s and can summon a legion of creepy [[disembodied hand]]s that are also [[one-eyed|single eyed]]. According to Phantoon's concept art in Metroid: Other M, the creature seen in the material world is only it's head, and the rest of it's body is in another dimension [tn]"[1]":[https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/metroid/images/4/41/Phantoonghost.jpg/][/tn].

It's lore in Super Metroid is contradictory between the Japanese and English manuals. In English it's a being that only taps into [[Mother Brain]]'s brainwaves to feed off it, while in Japanese it is Mother Brain's consciousness itself manifested.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25472049: Super Metroid
* !asset #25472050: Metroid: Other M

title: battle_of_the_coral_sea
body:
One of the first [[naval battle]]s of the Pacific theatre of operations in [[World War II]] fought between the [[United States Navy]] and the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] in May 1942, it was the first naval battle between [[aircraft carrier]]s and their air groups. It was fought without the [[ship]]s engaging each other directly. 

It ended in an apparent Japanese tactical victory due to the sinking of the American aircraft carrier the [[USS Lexington (CV-2)]] , but also in a decisive, but costly, American strategic victory due to the delay of the Japanese island hopping campaign and experience that helped their later success during the [[Battle of Midway]].

title: full_armor_unicorn_gundam
body:
The heavily armed upgrade of the [[unicorn_gundam|RX-0 Unicorn Gundam]]. It is piloted by [[Banagher Links]].

The Full Armor Mode was an enhancement plan devised by [[Irei Takuya]] while aboard the Nahel Argama and is based on Takuya's extensive knowledge of mobile suits. After Banagher's Newtype potential manifests itself, the [[Psycho Frame]] changes color to a vibrant green. Unlike other mobile suits with the Full Armor designation, the FA Unicorn does not consist of any additional armor for the MS frame itself (except extra [[shield|shields]]). However it does introduce a large array of weapons, which are added to the legs, backpack and forearms.

At first glance, what appears to be a haphazard collection of weaponry is actually a superbly balanced set-up which draws out the maximum combat potential of the Unicorn. The new array of weapons includes two backpack-mounted hyper bazookas, numerous hand grenades and grenade launchers, missile pods, forearm-mounted Gatling guns, and two additional I-field-equipped shields, one on the backpack and the other on the right forearm. The backpack also features two massive vernier-boosters taken from a [[base_jabber|Base Jabber Type 94]] to compensate for the increased mass, with one of the additional shields situated between them. The unit's entire weapons load can be disconnected at any time if the ammunitions are completely spent to avoid becoming dead-weight. Like the normal Unicorn, the Full Armor Unicorn can take control of an enemy's psycommu weapons, even Quasi-Psycommu bits, when the [[NT-D]] is activated.

Just like the original Unicorn, its Full Armor version is designed in real life by [[Katoki Hajime]].

title: magma_(medium)
body: [url=https://magma.com]Magma.com[/url] is a browser-based art creation and project management platform that uses generative AI to create finished pieces with other artists. The platform was founded in 2016 by artist and engineer Radek Eichler, who created the platform after realizing that no other tools allowed him to collaborate with his friends from around the world. Magma.com offers a free version of its platform, Magma Studio, and a premium version, Magma Pro, which includes additional features and a subscription service.

title: zhuge_liang
body:
A famous tactician from the Romance of the Three Kingdoms. Also known as "Kongming". Originally a man, but now has countless female portrayals.

Besides his portrayal in the book (Where he appears to be almost omniscient), there are a few memes and phrases involving his portrayal by Yokoyama Mitsuteru (Several variants of "Kongming's Trap" or "Now!") and his portrayal in Koei's games.

title: youmu_day
body: Youmu day is a holiday dedicated to [[Konpaku Youmu]] from [[Touhou]].  It is celebrated on the two dates that form Youmu's name in "goroawase":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_wordplay#Goroawase]: [b]April 6th[/b] (よ,む / yo,mu) and [b]August 6th[/b] (よう,む / you,mu).

title: ishowspeed
body: Darren Jason Watkins Jr. (born January 21, 2005), known online as IShowSpeed or simply Speed, is an American [[youtube|YouTuber]], media personality and online streamer. He is known for the dramatic and energetic behavior showcased in his variety live streams, as well as his in-real-life (IRL) streams in worldwide locations.

title: torpedo_bomber
body:
A type of [[bomber]] designed to carry [[torpedo]]es for attacking enemy [[warship]]s.

Though first used in [[World War I]], torpedo planes were most prevalent during [[World War II]], before their role was gradually replaced by multi-role aircraft and [[missile]]s.

title: dive_bomber
body:
A type of [[bomber]] designed for precision attacks. The "dive" in the name comes from the fact that most of these bombers are designed to enter a steep, near vertical dive when attacking their target to guarantee accuracy. 

This type of aircraft was only used during [[World War II]], as even during the conflict the dive bomber was already being replaced by multi-role aircraft.

title: kurashiki_akane
body:
A central character in [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu]], appearing in all three games. Childhood friend and love interest of [[Junpei (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]], and [spoiler]the true identity of [[Zero (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]]. [[Santa (kyokugen_dasshutsu)|]] is her older brother.[/spoiler]

Has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into a [[side ponytail]].

In [[kyokugen dasshutsu: 9 jikan 9 nin 9 no tobira|999]], she wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black shirt]] under a [[purple dress]], along with [[brown boots]] and [[multicolored socks]]. In this game only, she is referred to by the codename "Murasaki" ("June" in English).

A [[aged down|younger version]] of her is seen in flashbacks throughout the game. Unlike her present-day self, she has her [[hair down]]. She wears a [[pink shirt]] with a [[floral print|flower]] design over a [[collared shirt|collared]], [[white shirt]] and [[red necktie|red tie]], a [[black hairband]], a [[blue skirt]], and [[knee boots|knee-high]] [[black boots]].

In [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu Adv: Zennin Shibou Desu|Zennin Shibou Desu]], [spoiler]she appears as an [[old woman]] with [[grey hair]], wearing a [[blue dress|blue]] [[turtleneck dress]] with [[asymmetrical sleeves]], [[white shoes]], and a [[ring]] on her right hand. Her younger self appears at the very end of the game, donning the same [[gas mask]] she wore as Zero, as well as a [[black robe]].[/spoiler]

In [[zero escape: toki no dilemma|Toki no Dilemma]], she is a member of "C-Team" alongside Junpei and [[Carlos (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]]. She wears a [[cable knit]] [[dress]] over a [[purple shirt]]. Around her waist is a thick [[black sash|black cloth belt]] with a [[bow]] and gold [[buckle]] on the front. She has dark [[brown pantyhose]] on and wears dark [[red shoes|red]] [[oxfords|oxford]] [[flats]] with black laces.

h4. Appearance

title: futaba_sana_(swimsuit_costume)
body:
An unplayable [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[Futaba Sana]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

It is a [[green bikini|green]] [[plaid bikini]] with a [[frilled bikini|frilled]] [[halterneck]], a [[yellow ribbon]] on [[front-tie bikini top|front]] of the top and [[side-tie bikini bottom|sides]] of the bottom, and a [[bikini skirt]]. She also wears a [[single wrist cuff|wrist cuff]] and a [[ring]].

Her [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[medium hair|medium]] [[aqua hair]] is tied into [[hair rings|rings]] with a pair of [[yellow scrunchie]]s and she has [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[sidelocks]] and [[blunt bangs]].

title: futaba_sana_(roomwear_costume)
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Futaba Sana]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. Originally designed for a pop-up store in Tokyo Anime Center and released on merchandise in February 2022, though it was adapted into a in-game costume one year later.

Sana's [[medium hair|medium]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[aqua hair]] is tied into [[twintails]] with [[hair beads|beads]] and decorated with a [[Kyubey]]-[[objectification|themed]] [[sleep mask]]. She also has [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and [[green eyes]]. 

She wears a [[short dress|short]] [[green dress]] with [[vertical-striped dress|vertical stripes]], [[buttons]], [[short sleeves]] and a [[wing collar|wing]] [[collared dress|collar]], a [[ring]], a [[white jacket|white]] [[off shoulder|off-shoulder]] [[jacket]] with [[pocket]]s, [[yellow_leg_warmers|yellow]] [[leg warmers]] with a [[floral print|floral]] [[print leg warmers|print]] and [[green slippers]].

body:
Indie rock band from Nottingham, England formed between 1997 and 1998 which gained notoriety after their 2001 demo EP "D>E>A>T>H>M>E>T>A>L" was discovered by [[4chan]]'s /mu/ board. The band's current lineup consists of: Owain Davies, Andy Wright, Shaun Ferreday, John Schofield and Rob Harris.

title: zodiac_axis
body:
A mystery visual novel (story-based with choices) that blends suspense, romance, and Asian-inspired fantasy elements.

The main character, [[alison_harte|Alison Harte]], is a tabloid journalist who is assigned to investigate six unusual people who are rumored to carry the "Spirits of the Zodiacs", wielding mysterious powers connecting them to the ancient founders of Lunar City.

It was created by "LunaChaiLi" (Going under the name of "Studio Theophilus"), with a demo launching in 2017. Active development on the game was halted in January 2020 due to a combination of technical issues and creative burnout from the dev team. As of 2021, the game has halted development "in the background," with no official release date.

h4. External Links

Her weapons are a MG 151/20 machine gun and a 20mm MG FF cannon. She is based on "Helmut Lent":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helmut_Lent and her familiar is a German Shepard.

title: himeya_company_uniform
body:
The uniform worn by [[undine (aria)|Undines]] under the Himeya Company in [i][[ARIA (manga)|]][/i]. It has 2 different variations depending on the season:

The [[summer uniform|summer]] version consists of a red-trimmed, [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[white shirt|white]][[sailor shirt]] with a [[patch]] with the company [[logo]] on the left sleeve and red [[chevron (symbol)|]] on the other worn over a [[long dress|long]], [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]]. 

The [[winter uniform|winter]] version replaces the shirt with a [[white capelet]] with yellow or [[gold trim|golden trims]] and a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]], [[high collar|high-collared]] [[white dress]], a long-sleeved [[white shirt|white]] [[undershirt]] and a [[purple pantyhose]].

The dress in both versions has red trims and prominently features the company [[logo]] in red on both the front and the back, and is surprisingly [[skin tight]], almost to the point of being an [[impossible dress]] and has a cutout either on the front or the [[side slit|side]] of one of the legs.

Both versions feature [[red shoes|red]] [[pumps]], a [[red bowtie]] and a red-trimmed [[white headwear|white]] [[hat|cap]].

h4. See also

* [[Orange Planet uniform]]
* [[List of uniforms]]

title: infinite_(sonic)
body:
An antagonist character introduced in [[Sonic Forces]]. Under [[Dr. Eggman]]'s command, he was able to defeat [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]] using the power of the Phantom Ruby prototype [[chest jewel|in his chest]]. He is also able to create illusory copies of elements such as the environment or enemies of previous games (namely [[shadow_the_hedgehog|Shadow]], [[Metal Sonic]], [[Zavok (sonic)|]] and [[Chaos (sonic)|]]).
He was originally part of a mercenary group called the [[Jackal]] Squad, until they were all defeated by [[shadow_the hedgehog|Shadow]]. Under the [[mask]], he has [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[blue_eyes|blue]] and [[yellow eyes]].
other_names: インフィニット(ソニックフォース)

title: cream_the_rabbit
body:
A character from the [[sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series.

She's an anthropomorphic peach [[rabbit]] who made her debut in the 2002 release of [[Sonic Advance 2]], then [[Sonic X]], and finally making her canon debut in the 2003 release of [[Sonic Heroes]]. She's the daughter of [[Vanilla the Rabbit]]. She's generally a very cheery girl, who's always seen with her [[chao (sonic)|Chao]], [[Cheese (sonic)|Cheese]].

The fandom [[meme|memes]] about her being absurdly powerful due to how strong she is in [[sonic heroes|Heroes]] and [[Sonic Advance 2|Advance 2]].

h4. External links

title: akashi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese repair ship [i]Akashi[/i]. Character designed by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Taneda Risa]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[blunt tresses|freshly cut strands]] held by [[tress_ribbon|red tress ribbons]], as well as [[green eyes]].

The playable and NPC versions of Akashi have slightly different outfits. Both versions wear a [[serafuku]] (identical to [[Ooyodo (kancolle)|]]'s) on top of a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] zippered shirt, along with a [[blue_skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] with hakama-like [[hip_vent|hip vents]] and [[thighhighs]]. The NPC version has white stripes along the bottom edge of her skirt while the playable version has a wider red stripe along the edge.

The playable version wears pieces of [[armor]], propeller platform shoes and she has several cranes attached to her ship parts. Once remodeled, she wears a white [[bandana]] and actual weapons (mostly anti-air guns) are attached to her.

As an NPC, she runs the premium shop and the Large Ship Construction system. 

As a playable character, she is used to slowly repair minor damage to other ships if she is the flagship of a fleet. When set as secretary ship (first fleet flagship), she is able to improve equipment in her armory arsenal.

Naturally, she is usually paired with fellow NPC [[Ooyodo (kancolle)|]]. She is also occasionally paired with [[Yuubari (kancolle)|]], usually featuring their mutual love of tinkering with and improving equipment.

title: emerl_(sonic)
body:
An ancient [[humanoid robot]] that appears in [[Sonic Battle]]. Its original name was "Gizoid", but the name Emerl was given because of its ability to absorb [[chaos_emerald|Chaos Emeralds]].

Having been first researched upon by [[Gerald Robotnik]], It was discovered and subsequently abandoned by [[Dr. Eggman]]. Afterwards, Emerl begins traveling alongside [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]] and each of his friends, and grows gradually smarter and stronger by imitating their abilities and absorbing Emeralds. However, gaining power over one of Eggman's weapons forces Sonic to fight Emerl himself.

A different robot called [[Gemerl]] was created from Emerl's data, following its eventual destruction.

H4. External links
* "Sonic Fandom Wiki":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Emerl

title: star_wars:_empire_at_war
body: Star Wars: Empire at War is a 2006 real-time strategy video game developed by Petroglyph Games and published by LucasArts for Microsoft Windows and Mac OS X. Set between Episode III and Episode IV, it focuses on the fledgling struggle between the Empire and the Rebels. It uses Petroglyph's game engine Alamo. In October 2006, an expansion titled Star Wars: Empire at War: Forces of Corruption was released.

title: minotaur
body:
A creature with the head of a [[bull]] (or [[cow]]) on the body of a human. Originated from the [[Greek Mythology]] as a unique creature, but was later depicted as an entire species in fantasy media.

title: fate/apocrypha
body:
A 2012-2014 light novel spin-off of the [[Fate_(series)|]] series, written by Higashide Yuuichirou and illustrated by [[Konoe Ototsugu]].

Fate/Apocrypha is based around a parallel world to the [[Fate/stay night|]] canon, where the Holy Grail was removed from Fuyuki City after the third War. The plot focuses on the reappearance of the Grail at Trifas during the 2000s (around the time the fifth Fuyuki War would have occurred) and the rivalry between the Black and Red Factions, each composed of renegades and loyalists to the Mage's Association, respectively, each summoning seven Servants of each type, with the Grail itself summoning [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]] as mediator.

A manga adaptation has been serialized in [[Comp Ace]] magazine since 2016. An anime adaptation aired in 2017.

title: gnarly_knuckles
body:
A character from [i][[Sonic Prime]][/i]. He is an anthropomorphic echidna who is the Boscage Maze counterpart of [[Knuckles the Echidna]] from the main Sonic universe. He is part of a group called the Scavengers who protect the forest.

Gnarly is characterized by his extreme paranoia and suspicion of everything around him. He wears a hat made of leaves held together by rope, and his gloves have plant thorns instead of the typical spikes found on the original Knuckles' gloves. He fights using a spear that he can throw with great precision.

title: joy_boy_(one_piece)
body:
Prominent background character from [[One Piece]].

[b]Note: Major spoilers below:[/b]
[spoiler]Joy Boy was born around 900 years ago, and later on he would be known as the first pirate in history. He possesses the Hito Hito no Mi - Model: Nika Devil Fruit which allows him to transform into the Sun God Nika and uses his rubbery properties.

He sided with the "Great Kingdom" in a great war against the First Twenty alliance (the precursor of the World Government) and were defeated. After that, he left a treasure of unimaginable value later known as "One Piece" at the island of Laugh Tale, which [[Gol D. Roger]] later discovered. Due to his stance against the World Government, he was erased from the history as a part of the forbidden "Void Century".

It is said that the arrival of the avatar of Nika is the sign of the world heading towards the turning point. Currently, [[Monkey D. Luffy]] is the one who possesses the same Devil Fruit that Joy Boy possesses.

title: geara_doga_psycommu_test_type
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]AMS-120X Geara Doga Psycommu Test Type[/b]

A prototype experimental and heavily modified [[Geara Doga]] [[mobile_suit|MS]], it was featured in the original design series [i][[Char's Counterattack]] Mobile Suit Variations[/i].

One of the many Newtype-use mobile suits built for [[Char Aznable]]'s [[Neo Zeon]], it did not met expectations and was later used by [[Anaheim Electronics]] for developing the [[jagd_doga_quess_custom|Jagd Doga]]. Its [[beam rifle]] and torso [[beam cannon]] would also be later included as weaponry for the cutting edge [[Sazabi]] MS.

title: sandwich
body:
A food item consisting of two pieces of [[bread]] with one or more fillings between them. Different from a [[burger]] because sandwiches don't have a beef patty between them, instead using cold cut meats or warmed slices of meat.

title: mangey_(sonic)
body:
A character from the animated series [i][[Sonic Prime]][/i]. He is an alternate universe variant of [[Tails (Sonic)|Miles "Tails" Prower]], residing in the Boscage Maze universe. Unlike the original Tails, Mangey exhibits feral behavior, often moving on all fours and communicating through growls.

His appearance is more rugged, featuring disheveled orange fur, a white head tuft, and distinctive vermilion-tipped ears. He also sports a fauxhawk with crimson spikes and has small tusks. His attire includes gloves wrapped with leaves, a green belt with brown pockets, and shoes made of leaves held together by ropes.

title: mecha_knuckles
body: A robotic doppelgänger of [[Knuckles the Echidna]] in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]]. Created by [[Dr. Eggman]], he first appears as the boss of Angel Island in [i][[Sonic Advance]][/i]. Initially, Mecha Knuckles resembles Knuckles but with magenta fur, blue eyes, and yellow gloves. Upon sustaining damage, his outer layer falls away to reveal a more mechanical form. He possesses abilities akin to Knuckles, such as gliding and the Spin Dash, and in his second form, he can launch homing missiles from his mouth.

title: sinbad_(sonic)
body:
A character from the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]], specifically appearing in [i][[Sonic and the Secret Rings]][/i]. He is an alternate universe variant of [[Knuckles the Echidna]], residing in the world of the Arabian Nights.

Sinbad's appearance mirrors Knuckles', with distinguishing attire reflecting Arabian culture: a white keffiyeh, white dishdasha with a purple belt, and gray metal wristlets. He wields a yellow-curved dagger adorned with a ruby at the handle's end.

title: staff_of_selection_(fate)
body:

In her [[Artoria Caster (third ascension) (fate)|third ascension]], she trades out the staff for [[Marmyadose (fate)|]] as her primary weapon in battle.

[spoiler][[Aesc (fate)|]] originally had a similar Spear of Selection, but it became corrupted after she lost faith in the fairies of Britain and she sealed it away. The various staffs she's seen with are instead ordinary staffs. This spear would later be gifted to [[Percival (fate)|]], whereupon it transformed into a [[Longinus (weapon) (fate)|Longinus]] look-alike.[/spoiler]

During the [[Chaldea Summer Adventure]] event, its personality gains a [[Rengoku (fate)|humanoid form]], and both itself and [[Okita Souji Alter (Swimsuit Saber) (fate)|]] utilize modified versions of Rengoku's sword form. During the [[GUDAGUDA Shin Yamatai-koku]] event, he possesses her body as the dominant personality under the name [[Rengoku Alter (fate)|]], resulting in her gaining a [[flat chest]].

Not to be confused with other ordinary [[katana]]s that she wields.

body:

It would later be wielded by [[Percival (Fate)|]] and become one of his noble phantasms.

[spoiler]In the British lostbelt, [[Aesc (fate)|]]'s [[Staff of Selection (fate)|Spear of Selection]] transformed into a Longinus look-alike after it was gifted to the Lostbelt version of Percival by [[Aurora (fate)|]].[/spoiler]

title: zelretch_sword
body:
One of [[kischur zelretch schweinorg|Zelretch]]'s Mystic codes and his main weapon. Commonly referred to as the "Jeweled Sword Zelretch" it's a jagged ceremonial ritual dagger with jewels encrusted in its hilt. The sword allows the user to channel into the blade potentially infinite magical energy which can then be fired off in a blinding stream of light.

Zelretch carries the original, and he has left blueprints of the sword with the Tohsaka family as a sort of long-term homework that he expects will take many generations. During [[Heaven's Feel]], the sword is created by using these blueprints and other plot devices and [[Tohsaka Rin]] brandishes it [spoiler]to fight [[Matou Sakura]][/spoiler] in the climax of the route. The sword created is inferior to the original, and using it causes Rin's muscles to be damaged.

* !post #8978747

title: rei_(hokuto_no_ken)
body:
[b]Rei[/b] ([b]レイ[/b]) is a character from [[Hokuto no Ken]].

He is the successor of Nanto Suichou Ken (南斗水鳥拳, "South Star Waterfowl Fist"), which is said to be the most elegant of the Nanto Seiken styles, and represents the Star of Justice (義星, Gi-sei). While away on training, his home village was attacked by a "Man with Seven Scars" (who was actually [[Jagi]] imposted as his brother [[Kenshiro]]), who killed Rei's parents and kidnapped his sister [[Airi_(hokuto_no_ken)|Airi]].

Rei later accompanied with [[Kenshiro]] in a quest to taking back his sister (who's later being sold as slave). After Jagi is defeated and knowing the truth about "Man with Seven Scars", Rei later became a close friend with Kenshiro and helped him in a quest to find his lost adopted brother, [[Toki (hokuto no ken)|]].

Voiced by Shiozawa Kaneto.

h4. Known moves

* 南斗虎破龍 ([i]Nanto Ko Ha Ryuu[/i])
** Places the opponent in a temporary death-like coma. Rei's counterpart to [[Kenshiro]]'s [i]Hokuto Ryuu Geki Ko[/i].

* 飛燕流舞 ([i]Hien Ryubu[/i])
** An aerial technique that uses the air to slice through objects.

* 飛翔白麗 ([i][[Hishou Hakurei]][/i])
** The ultimate Suichou Ken technique. A jumping mid-air double stabbing attack. [spoiler]Used to kill [[Yuda_(hokuto_no_ken)|Juda]].[/spoiler]

* 断己相殺拳 ([i]Danko Sousai Ken[/i])
** The ultimate suicide technique that kills an opponent at the expense of the user. [spoiler]Attempted to used to kill [[Raoh_(hokuto_no_ken)|]].[/spoiler]

title: windows_10
body:
A major release of the [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] operating system developed by [[Microsoft]] that was released to retail on July 29, 2015. 

As a successor to Windows 8.1, it became available to users of [[Windows 7]], [[Windows 8]] and 8.1 as a free upgrade.

It received praise for its return to a familiar desktop interface and improved software, though it faced criticism for mandatory updates and privacy concerns. Unlike previous releases, Windows 10 receives ongoing updates at no additional cost, with enterprise users having the option for long-term support.

Support for Windows 10 editions which are not in the Long-Term Servicing Channel (LTSC) is set to end on October 14, 2025.

It was succeeded by [[Windows 11]], which was released on October 5, 2021.

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Windows 10":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_10]
* "Download Windows 10 - microsoft.com":[https://www.microsoft.com/en-au/software-download/windows10]

title: ford_gt
body:
The Ford GT is a mid-engine two-seater sports car manufactured and marketed by American automobile manufacturer [[Ford]] as a road legal homage to the [[Ford GT40]] road car. The first iteration of the modern Ford GT was produced from 2004 to 2006, while a second iteration ran from 2017 to 2022. The second iteration had various enhanced track-only variants, including the final Ford GT Mk IV.

Prior to the release of the road car, Ford presented a concept for a modernized take on the GT40 in 1995 with the [[Ford GT90]], though that take on the model did not reach production.

title: yoshida_ayumi
body: A classmate of [[Edogawa Conan]]'s, a cheerful and enthusiastic girl who loves to solve cases with her friends Conan, [[Tsuburaya Mitsuhiko]], [[Kojima Genta]] and [[Haibara Ai]].

title: haibara_ai
body:
A girl who used to be called [[Miyano Shiho]] and was in the Black Organization under the code name Sherry. After the Organization kills her older sister [[Miyano Akemi]], Shiho takes the same drug that shrunk [[Kudou Shin'ichi]] and likewise becomes a child herself to escape, renaming herself Haibara Ai. She is blunt and cool-headed, but becomes frightened whenever the Organization is discussed or nearby.

Her name comes from fictional detective [[Cordelia Gray]] (灰 = gray) and Sherlock Holmes character [[Irene Adler]].

title: takagi_wataru_(meitantei_conan)
body:
A police detective and [[Satou Miwako]]'s love interest. He is trustworthy, but tends to be nervous when trying to be casual with Miwako.

He is named after the voice actor [[Takagi Wataru (voice Actor)|]], who voices him as well as [[Kojima Genta]], after the voice actor ad-libbed his own name as the (then unnamed) character's name.

title: satou_miwako
body: A police detective and [[Takagi Wataru (meitantei conan)|]]'s love interest. She's very boyish and knows martial arts, but is terrified of ferris wheels due to what happened to her colleague [[Matsuda Jinpei]].

body:
When a woman's [[pussy]] contains [[sharp teeth]]; [i]vagina dentata[/i] is Latin for [i]toothed vagina[/i]. It's derived from an old wives tale designed to caution men of having intercourse with a woman they don't know lest they risk emasculation. On Danbooru, this often refers to [[monster girl|monster girls]] with teeth on their vagina.

The movie [i]Teeth[/i] features a protagonist with vagina dentata.

title: vector_art
body:
Vector graphics are a form of computer graphics in which visual images are created directly from geometric shapes defined on a Cartesian plane, such as points, lines, curves and polygons. The associated mechanisms may include vector display and printing hardware, vector data models and file formats, as well as the software based on these data models (especially graphic design software, computer-aided design, and geographic information systems). Vector graphics are an alternative to raster or bitmap graphics, with each having advantages and disadvantages in specific situations.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vector_graphics

title: freddy_krueger
body: The killer from the [[horror (theme)|]] film series [i][[A Nightmare On Elm Street]][/i]. The malignant spirit of a child-killer who was killed when the parents of Elm Street took the law into their own hands after he got off on a technicality, Freddy seeks revenge upon them by going after their children. He does this by attacking his victims in the dream world, any damage that he inflicts in a dream crossing over into the real world, meaning that if someone dies in a dream he is invading, they die for real. One of his trademarks is the [[claw (weapon)|clawed glove]]  that he wears on his right hand, which he uses as his primary weapon.

title: rei_no_pool
body:
[b]Rei no pool[/b] (例のプール, lit. "the usual pool"), officially called the[b] Hanazono Room[/b], is that indoor swimming [[pool]] with angled solarium windows which can be seen in just about every pool-related Japanese adult video ever.

It is located on the top floor of a building in [[Shinjuku (tokyo)|]], and was formerly part of a private penthouse apartment during the area's economic boom. It's now owned by a company that rents locations for video shoots. Surprisingly for a studio frequently used to film porn, it overlooks an elementary school.

The pool virtually ceased being available for JAV shoots in 2020 due to the rising cost of facility maintenance expenses to clean up afterwards. The pool remains open for non-AV shoots such as gravure and non-pornographic shoots.

Despite its reputation as a common location for JAVs, the pool has recently been featured in a handful of mainstream productions as well, including an episode of [[Kamen Rider Fourze (Series)|]].

A person who forges the metals iron and steel into various shapes (such as tools, furniture, nails, and weapons). They would typically use tools such as [[hammer]], [[anvil]], [[tongs]], and forge (furnace for heating metals).

For the Ragnarok Online character class see the [[Blacksmith_(ragnarok_online)]] tag.

h4. See also

* [[Horseshoe]]
* [[Tag group:jobs]]

title: workshop
body:
A [[room]] in a domestic residence or apartment dedicated to working on projects such as [[sewing]], [[painting (action)|]], art, or similar activities. All of the materials needed for the project can be found in the workshop. Also called an [i]atelier[/i], from which the [[atelier (series)|Atelier]] series is based off of.

h4.See also

* [[art room]]

title: ok_sign
body:
A hand gesture consisting of the index finger and thumb touching at the tips, creating a circle.

Do not confuse with the [[money gesture]] (post #4384256). The [[money gesture]] looks similar, but with the hand kept horizontal and the circle pointed outwards, away from the person making the gesture.

h4. See also

title: sleeveless_shirt
body:
A style of [[shirt]] that doesn't have any distinctive sleeves attached to the main torso garment. Should not be confused with [[tank top]], as they are intended to be [[sleeveless]].

Sleeveless shirt can be used together with [[detached sleeves]], since sleeveless shirt only refers to the torso garment, and do not take detached sleeves into account.

h4.Correct examples
* !post #7948311
* !post #6642898
* !post #7298145: A sleeveless shirt worn with [[detached sleeves]]
* !post #7033940: A sleeveless shirt worn with [[elbow gloves]]
* !post #6663441: A sleeveless shirt worn with a [[jacket]]

h4.Incorrect examples
Sleeveless shirts, [[strapless shirt]]s, and [[off-shoulder shirt]]s are mutually exclusive to each other.
* !post #8017970: [[Strapless shirt]]
* !post #6962182: [[Off-shoulder shirt]]
* !post #6582110: [[Tube top]]

h4. See Also

* [[halter shirt]]
* [[sideless shirt]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

A short, [[sleeveless]] top with [[spaghetti strap|thin straps]]. Camisoles can be worn as regular garments, but they can also be worn as an [[undershirt]].

A top with wide straps is called a [[tank top]]. A camisole that goes past the waist might be called a [[babydoll]] or [[chemise]].

title: hime_cut
body:
A hairstyle consisting of [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair]], [[blunt bangs]], and [[sidelocks]] with [[blunt ends]].

All elements must be present to be considered a hime cut. The hair must be long and straight and the [[bangs]] and [[sidelocks]] must have blunt ends.

As the name suggests, the style is thought to have originated, or at least become common, in the Imperial court during the Heian Period of Japanese history, when noble women would sometimes [[absurdly long hair|grow out their hair for their entire lives]].

h4. Example
* !post #7467939
* !post #7546725
* !post #6280561


h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Hime cut":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hime_cut

The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VSPO!]]'s [[Shinomiya Runa]], released on the 31st of March, 2025. It is a [[yume kawaii|yumekawa]] angelic-themed (天使) costume designed by [[manabu]].

She wears an open [[white cardigan]] and a long [[purple shirt]] underneath with an [[o-ring harness|o-ring]] [[chest harness]] and a pair of [[wings]] on her back. title: ra's_mirror
body: [B]Ra's Mirror[/b], alternatively referred to as the [b]Mirror of Light[/b], is a recurring key item in the [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] franchise. It is a circular [[mirror]] with a gold and green palette. First appearing in [i][[Dragon Quest II]][/i], the mirror is able to project the true form of those who it is pointed at, such as reverting the [[Princess of Moonbrook]] back to a human after she was cursed to take the form of a [[dog]].

In terms of appearance, Renegade Knucks shares similarities with the main Sonic universe's Knuckles but has some distinct differences, including scars over his dreadlock-like spines, an 'X'-shaped scar on his forehead, and wears different attire including a black beanie with the Resistance's symbol, red and black boots, and black and green gauntlet-like accessories on his gloves.

body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. She is unique in that she fights while piloting a [[mecha]], a sentient robot of her own design named [[talos (nikke)|T.A.L.O.S.]]. In her own official art she is only briefly visible.

She is a [[petite]] girl with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] and yellow-green eyes. She has very [[small breasts]] (in fanart, she may range from [[flat chest]] to [[medium breasts]]). She wears a [[shrug]] with a [[fur trim|fur-trimmed]] collar and a black [[microskirt]] over a gray [[leotard]] and [[pantyhose]]. She is currently the sole member of the squad "Heavy Gram".

title: gauze
body:
A piece of fabric used to cover wounds, generally on an injury too large for a [[bandaid]].   
Gauze often comes as a square pad and is [[tape|taped]] onto the skin, though self adhesive versions do exist.

It can also come in rolls that when applied become [[bandages]].

h4. See also

h6. Gauze on head/face
* [[gauze on face]]
** [[gauze on cheek]]
** [[gauze over eye]]
** [[gauze on nose]]
** [[gauze on forehead]]
* [[gauze on head]]

h6. Gauze on limbs
* [[gauze on arm]]
** [[gauze on elbow]]
** [[gauze on hand]]

title: digimon_adventure
body:
The first [[Digimon]] series. Seven ordinary kids are caught up in a strange snowstorm while attending summer camp and get sucked through a portal into the Digital World, a fantasy world populated by sentient monsters called [[Digimon (creature)|]]. Armed with the mysterious "Digivices" and seven Digimon who are sworn to protect them, the kids try to survive in this new and exotic world until they can find a way home.

title: andersen_(nikke)
body:
An NPC from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. One of the Deputy Chiefs of the Ark's Central Government Command.

While he shares the same blood as the [[Commander (nikke)|]], they are not related at all. Andersen has an unusual obsession with the Pilgrims, as he built a Tribe Tower for them, and seeks to obtain information regarding their weapons, combat data, and so on. He also sees himself as a "representative" for the Pilgrims.

His name may be a reference to Hans Christian Andersen, analogous to the members of the [[Goddess (Nikke)|]] squad being named after fairy tale characters. This, his preoccupation with Pigrims and some other circumstantial evidence may hint that [spoiler]he is [[The Legendary Commander (nikke)|]] (somehow having not aged significantly in 50+ years) or connected to him in some way.[/spoiler]
other_names: アンダーソン(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: bindi
body:
A [[forehead mark]] that consists of a colored dot (or sticker) worn on the center of the forehead. It is worn by Hindus, Jains and Buddhists from the Indian subcontinent. The mark is always applied close to the eyebrows or in the middle of the forehead 

Note that China historically had a mark similar to the bindi, called the cinnabar mole (朱砂痣, zhushazhi) or the dot cinnabar (点丹 diandan). The cinnabar it was made from gave it the red pigment, but was highly toxic. It was used as a status symbol, with links to [[taoism]].

Use [[forehead mark]] or [[circle facial mark]] instead if the image has no correlation with [[Hinduism]], [[Buddhism]] or [[Jainism]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7118924

h4.See also

* [[Facial mark]]
* [[Huadian]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bindi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bindi_(decoration)]

title: featherine_augustus_aurora
body:
A character from [[Umineko No Naku Koro Ni]]. The Witch of the Theater, she is said to have been the Game Master for countless other games in the past, though she has long-forgotten them. She possesses a crescent-shaped device which floats around her head, serving as a memory aid which maintains traits such as her name, appearance, and personality. She has [[Ushiromiya Ange]] read the story of Dawn of the Golden Witch and challenges her to find the truth about it. She may or may not be the true form of [[Hachijou Ikuko]].

While it is not confirmed they are the same character, she is nearly identical in appearance to the character [[Eua (higurashi)|]] from the anime [[Higurashi No Naku Koro Ni]] Gou.
other_names: フェザリーヌ・アウグストゥス・アウローラ

title: takanashi_kiara_(knight)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Takanashi Kiara]], revealed on July 24, 2023.

It consists of a [[layered dress]] [[armored dress]] styled after a [[boobplate]] with an [[underbust]] [[chest belt]], worn over a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black_shirt|black]] [[high collar]]ed [[see-through shirt]] with [[embroidery]], a grey [[gambeson]] (with a [[zipper]] for some reason) and a [[black_skirt|black]] [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] [[skirt under dress|underneath]], [[vambraces]] with [[blue gloves|dark blue]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[waist cape]] styled after wings, [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]] styled [[greaves]] with [[blue thighhighs]] [[thighhighs under boots|underneath]], and [[sabaton]]s. She also has an optional [[zweihander]] [[sword on back|on her back]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume both of which are decorated with a [[crystal hair ornament|crystal]] [[headpiece]] and having [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored tips]], [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[colored inner hair]]:
* [[Short hair]] with [[short hair with long locks|long]] [[sidelocks]] and [[double-parted bangs]]
* [[Long hair]] done in a [[high ponytail]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #7035375: Profile (medium hair)
* !post #6526173: Profile (long hair)

title: capable_(mad_max)
body:
A character from [[Mad Max: Fury Road]]. One of [[Immortan Joe]]'s "wives" who he keeps in his private vault in order for them to bear him non-mutated children, she along with the Wives join [[Imperator Furiosa]] to escape their imprisonment, leading to the events of the movie. 

Capable is played by Riley Keough, the granddaughter of [[Elvis Presley]].

title: the_doof_warrior
body:
A minor character in [[Mad Max: Fury Road]] that received a lot of popularity despite very limited screen time.

He is a blind, pale man wearing a red onesie. He is most notable for playing a flame-spewing [[double neck guitar]] atop [[the doof wagon]], a vehicle carrying a large wall of [[speaker]]s that accompanies [[Immortan Joe]] during the length of the film's car chase.

He is played by Australian singer iOTA while some the character's stunt were performed by Ben Smith-Petersen, who would later marry [[Capable (mad max)|]]'s actress, Riley Keough.
other_names: ドゥーフ・ウォーリアー

title: mary_(quartet)
body:
Character from the 1986 [[Quartet (game)|Quartet]] arcade game by [[Sega]].

She also serves as the main protagonist in the Sega Master System version.

Her appearance in the arcade version consists of a [[red shirt|red]] [[sleeveless]] [[crop top]], a red [[bikini bottom only|bikini bottom]], [[red boots]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair]]. Her appearance in the Sega Master System version changes the bikini bottom to a [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], [[white boots|white]] [[knee boots]], and her hair is in a [[ponytail]].

title: dorohedoro
body:
A fantasy seinen manga series drawn by Hayashida Q, which ran from 2000 to 2018. It moved between magazines during its run, starting in Monthly Ikki from 2000 to 2014 and then moving to Hibana from 2015 to 2017 and Monthly Shonen Sunday from 2017 to 2018.

Caiman is amnesiac and has the head of a crocodile. Believing that it's a Magic user's work, he tries to get back both his memories and human face by hunting Magic users.

The series is best known for its black humor and moral ambiguity.

title: nelson_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the battleship HMS [i]Nelson[/i] (pennant no. 28). Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Nomizu Iori]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey jacket|grey]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] closed [[cropped jacket]], short [[red necktie]] with a [[red rose]], [[black dress]], [[black thighhighs]], [[thigh strap]]s, and [[grey shoes|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her strictly military appearance contrasts greatly with Warspite's regal one due to their respective classes' namesakes being of admiralty and of royalty respectively. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of three hull pieces, one to her back and two to her sides, with the armament arranged asymetrically (15.2 cm twin gun mounts on her left, [[anti-aircraft gun]]s plus her funnel and mast to her back, and her three 406 mmt triple gun mounts to her right) and controlled by a [[joystick]]. She also has her real-life fire directors as [[headgear]]. 

At Kai, Nelson's jacket gains darker sleeves, and her rigging obtains a camouflage pattern. 

In the game, she is capable of a special cut-in sequence: the "Nelson Touch". It is also a "historical term":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Nelson_Touch], referring either to Vice Admiral Nelson's naval strategy that he used to great success or the broader sense of naval superiority the Royal Navy enjoyed during the 1800s after the British victory in the Battle of Trafalgar despite Vice Admiral Nelson's death during that time.

title: rodney_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] battleship HMS [i]Rodney[/i] (29), drawn by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]]. 

Rodney, like her sister Nelson, has [[blue eyes]] and [[blonde hair]], though Rodney's is [[short hair|cut short]] in contrast. She wears a dark [[grey dress]], with a lighter [[grey jacket]] atop it and a [[red rose]] [[ascot]]. Her Kai form has the jacket turn [[two-tone]], and the shoulders and collar turn dark grey. 

Like Nelson's, Rodney's [[rigging]] is arranged in three pieces in an asymmetrical fashion, but in a reverse arrangement to that of Nelson: main battery turrets and [[joystick]] control to Rodney's left, secondary battery and [[anti-aircraft gun]]s to her right, and funnel behind the back. Base Rodney's rigging is colored standard Navy grey, but Kai adds blue camouflage coloring to the sides.

title: yotsuba_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
A character from [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu]], introduced in [[kyokugen dasshutsu: 9 jikan 9 nin 9 no tobira|9 Jikan 9 Nin 9 no Tobira]]. Known as "Clover" in English.

Has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] and [[aqua eyes]].

In 999, she wears a [[black jacket]] over a [[pink dress]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], [[fur leg warmers]], [[black boots|black]] [[high heel boots]], white [[earmuffs]] with a [[leopard print]], and a [[plaid bow|plaid]] [[red bow]].

In [[kyokugen dasshutsu adv: zennin shibou desu|Zennin Shibou Desu]], she has [[drill hair]] that is a lighter shade than in 999, as well as two [[pom pom hair ornament]]s. She wears a pink and black dotted [[fur trim|fur]] top that covers her [[cleavage]] with a [[black ribbon]] hanging down, two [[bracelet]]s on her right wrist, [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], a [[black belt]] with a [[clover]]-shaped [[buckle]], [[fur-trimmed legwear|fur-trimmed]] [[black leggings]] with [[black bow]]s, and [[purple high heels]] with [[pink bow]]s. She is often seen alongside [[Alice (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]] in this game.

[[Niels (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]] is her older brother.

h4. Appearance
* !post #9107437: [[kyokugen dasshutsu: 9 jikan 9 nin 9 no tobira|999]]

title: shuna_no_tabi
body: Single volume full-color manga written by [[Miyazaki Hayao]] in 1983. Contains several similarities in characters, setting, and themes with [[Kaze no Tani no Nausicaa]], [[Mononoke Hime]], and [[Gedo Senki]]. It tells the story of a prince who travels in search of the Golden Wheat to save his people from starving. The English title has been rendered as "The Journey of Shuna"/"Shuna's Journey".

title: tails_(detective)_(sonic)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|official costume]] of [[Sonic (series)|]]'s [[Tails (sonic)|]], used in [i][[Sonic Speed Simulator]][/i]. Notably, it predates his ensemble from [i][[The Murder of Sonic the Hedgehog]][/i] by a year.

The outfit consists of:
* A brown plaid deerstalker hat
* A beige detective-style [[jacket]] that falls to about his hips, with a collar and visible front pockets.
* A red [[necktie]].

* The same plaid pattern from his hat and cuffs is used around the shoe collars (almost like spats or folded-over cuffs).

title: slam_dunk_(series)
body:
A 1990-1996 [[basketball]] manga series by [[Inoue Takehiko]].

[[Sakuragi Hanamichi]] is a delinquent from Shohoku High School with an extremely unlucky love life. One day he meets and falls in love with basketball fan [[Akagi Haruko]], and to impress her, he joins their school's basketball team, captained by Haruko's hulking older brother Takenori, only to learn that he is better suited to the sport than he would ever admit.

The series was immensely popular, becoming the 7th best-selling manga of all time and single-handedly popularizing basketball in Japan.

title: captain_titus
body:
The player character and protagonist of [[warhammer 40k: space marine|Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine I and II]], Captain (later Lieutenant) Demetrian Titus served as the commander of the [[Ultramarines]]' Second Company until the events of the first [i]Space Marine[/i] game saw him taken into the custody of the [[Inquisition]]. After being released following his captivity, Titus, assuming that his chapter had expunged his records given the circumstances of his detainment, would join the [[Deathwatch]] as a Blackshield. A botched mission against the [[tyranid|Tyranids]] would see him mortally wounded and turned into a Primaris Marine in order to survive. Afterwards, he would rejoin the Ultramarines (who had never forgotten him at all) with honors, though his absence would see him reinstated as a Lieutenant with Second Company having long been under new command.

He is known for his more lax attitude towards the [i]Codex Astartes[/i] and his high resistance to the effects of the Warp and Chaos, the later of which has seen suspicion repeatedly cast upon him.

title: mecha_pilot_suit
body:
A [[bodysuit]] worn by [[pilot]]s of [[mecha]], or a bodysuit associated with [[science fiction]] in general.

They typically have thicker material than a [[leotard]] (possibly similar to [[latex]]), one or more adornments or structures, parts/patches, and associated colors, lights, etc. Arm and leg covers may be anywhere from none to full.

This tag is for the fictional mecha pilot bodysuit; for the real life jumpsuit worn by pilots, uses [[flight suit]] instead.

title: bruise_on_knee
body: Knee injuries typical of falls, impacts, or friction against a hard surface. The knees are covered in bruises (hematomas), and the skin may be swollen with purple, blue, or yellowish patches due to damage to the subcutaneous blood vessels. There may also be superficial scrapes where the top layer of skin (epidermis) is worn away, sometimes with visible blood or serous fluid. The wounds can be contaminated with dirt or gravel, especially if the fall occurred on asphalt or rough ground.

title: roto's_emblem
body: [B]Roto's Emblem[/b], otherwise known as [b]Erdrick's Emblem[/b] in English localizations, is the symbol associated with the heroes in the [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] series. The symbol is in the shape of a bird, likely an eagle, with either red dot or [[red gemstone]] in the middle. It is notably visible on [[Erdrick's Shield]] and the [[tabard]] of the [[Prince of Samantoria]].

title: dukemon
body:
Ultimate-level Holy Knight-type [[Digimon (creature)|]] that debuted in [[Digimon Tamers]] in 2001, and one of the thirteen Royal Knights of the Digital World. Dukemon is often depicted as the true final evolution of [[Guilmon]], contrasting the wicked [[Megidramon]]. Dukemon is a large knight-esque Digimon clad in [[white armor|white]] [[armor]] and a [[red cape|red]] [[cape]]. In its right hand, it wields the holy [[lance]] [i]Gram[/i], and its left hand carries the holy [[shield]] [i]Aegis[/i]. Its offensive and defensive prowess is said to be unrivaled even among the Royal Knights, and it possesses the titles of "Crimson Knight" and "Sky-Conquering Armored Lancer", the latter making reference to its armored flying platform [[Grani (digimon)|ZERO-ARMS: Grani]].

In a number of narratives, including [[Digital Monster X-Evolution|Digimon X-Evolution]] and [[Digimon World Re:Digitize Decode]], Dukemon stands in opposition with its fellow Royal Knight [[Omegamon]]. The Royal Knight depicted here is noted to value potential in lifeforms.

Dukemon is referred to as [b]Gallantmon[/b] in international material.

[u]Common evolutionary throughline:[/u]
[[Jyarimon]] -> [[Gigimon]] -> [[Guilmon]] -> [[Growmon]] -> [[Megalogrowmon|Megalo Growmon]] -> [[Megidramon]] / [b]Dukemon[/b]
* Dukemon can evolve further with the [[Dukemon X-Antibody|X-Antibody]].
* By using the power of ZERO-ARMS: Grani, Dukemon will evolve to [[Dukemon Crimson Mode]].
* Dukemon has a sinister counterpart in [[Chaosdukemon|Chaos Dukemon]], which has embraced its potential as the Digital Hazard.

body:
[[dark_angel_olivia|Dark Angel Olivia]] in her summer outfit. Released July 31st, 2018.

In hopes of reviving her brethren, the fallen archangel of dusk studies the ways of those who inhabit the Sky Realm. body:

title: through_window
body:
When a character's body is passing or leaning halfway through a window frame - possibly to reach something, or to escape an area.

* !post #7666042

Do not use when the character smashes through a window, use [[breaking through window]] instead.

If the character is leaning on the window, use [[leaning out of window]].

Not to be confused with, though they're not mutually exclusive:
* [[from outside]], a viewpoint from outside through a window.
* [[looking outside]], character is looking through a window.

h4. See also
* [[against glass]]
* [[defenestration]]
* [[sitting in window]]
* [[through screen]]
* [[through sunroof]]

title: aquarius_camus
body:
[[Gold Saint]] of the Aquarius constellation in the original [[Saint Seiya]] anime and manga series.

Known as "the Mage of Water and Ice". He is the master of [[Cygnus Hyouga]] in the original manga and trained him in the icy tundras of Eastern Siberia. However, in the anime, he bears no personal relation to Hyoga and instead trained the anime-original character, the Crystal Saint, who is Hyoga's master in the anime.

In the original manga, he has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]], [[red eyes]] and [[red nails|red fingernails]]. In the anime adaptation, his [[blue hair|hair]] and [[blue eyes|eyes]] were made blue and he lacks any [[nail polish]].

title: power_armor
body:
[b]Power Armor[/b] is a term commonly used to describe full-body armor that not only protects, but enhances physical capabilities. Unlike regular body [[armor]], this includes some form of powered [[exoskeleton]] or [[power suit]] to act as mechanical muscle, reducing the user's amount of work to do just about anything. A common form of armor in [[science fiction]] and [[tokusatsu]], especially in [[space]] environments - a popular example is [[Samus Aran]].

One of the first appearances of power armor in science fiction was in the novel [[Starship Troopers]] (1959).

h1. Notable Power Armor Characters & Copyrights
* [[Iron Man]] ([[Marvel]])
* [[Master Chief]] ([[Halo (series)|]])
* [[marine_(starcraft)|Terran Marine]] ([[StarCraft]])
* [[Samus Aran]] ([[Metroid]])
* [[Doomguy]] ([[Doom i]])
* [[Pharah (overwatch)|]] ([[Overwatch]])
* [[Fallout]] series
* [[Bubblegum Crisis]]
* [[Warhammer 40K]]
* Certain [[Kamen Rider]] series
* [[Mospeada (mecha)]]/[[Mospeada]]
* [[Queadluun-Rau]]/[[MACROSS]]

h1. Series-Specific Tags
* [[Mobile Infantry]] ([[Starship Troopers]])
* [[Protect Gear]] ([[Kerberos Saga]])
* [[Spartan (Halo)|]] ([[Halo (series)|]])
* [[Varia Suit]] ([[Metroid]])
* [[Ultraman Suit (hero's Comics)|]] ([[ULTRAMAN (Hero's Comics)]])

title: sensha_otoko
body:
Type-Moon Official April Fool's Joke for April 2009, Sensha Otoko (Tank Man, a parody of the popular "true story" love comedy, [[Densha Otoko]] (Train Man)). The characters are mostly from Fate/Zero, with a few appearances from Fate/Stay Night characters. 

This is a story about 212cm military otaku with "Sensha Otoko" as his handle name, who despite his huge, imposing appearance, is actually very shy, and thus no girlfriends. One day, he saves a teenage girl from being harassed, and falls in love. However, because he has no experience in romance, he consults his [[otaku]] friends on the web-board Eirei Throne-Channel for advice. This is the beginning of a True Tank Story.

h4. Character 

h6. Main Characters

* [[iskandar (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Sensha Otoko"]] - Protagonist. ([[Iskandar (fate)|]])
* [[waver velvet (sensha otoko)|"El-Melloi Girl"]] - Heroine. ([[Waver Velvet]])

h6. Sensha Otoko's Friends From Eirei Throne Channel

* [[medea (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Medea"]] - a former model betrayed by her boyfriend. ([[Medea (caster) (fate)|]])
* [[gilgamesh (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Gil"]] - a cool hikikomori stalker. ([[Gilgamesh (fate)|]])
* [[berserker (sensha otoko) (fate)|"U to O"]] - a helmet-wearing man who fears facial exposure and eye-contact. ([[Berserker (Fate/Zero)]])
* "Danna" - Criminal No. 1. ([[Gilles de rais (caster) (fate)|]])
* "Ryuu-chan" - Criminal No. 2. ([[Uryuu Ryuunosuke]])
* "Godbull" - an intelligent fighter bull who knows how to access the internet.

h6. El-Melloi Family

* Papa - a man who loves his wife above all else, and despises his son. ([[Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald]])
* Mama - a woman who loves her eldest son above all else. ([[Sola-Ui Nuada-Re Sophia-Ri]])
* [[diarmuid ua duibhne (sensha otoko) (fate)|Onii-chan]] - an older brother who loves his younger sister above all else. ([[Diarmuid ua duibhne (lancer) (fate)|]])

h6. Supporting Cast

* [[sasaki kojirou (sensha otoko) (fate)|Sasaki]] - Medea's friendzoned male caretaker. ([[Sasaki kojirou (fate)|]])
* [[enkidu (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Enkidu-chan"]] - "Gil's" childhood friend and next door neighbor, a girl who loves her dog. ([[Enkidu (fate)|]])
* Matsuken - a mysterious, wise English teacher. 
* [[Kotomine Kirei (sensha otoko)|]] - The Tohsaka family's housekeeper, and "Gil's" caretaker.

h4. External links

* "Official Site":http://tatari.byethost33.com/tmfools/09/sensya/intro.htm
* "Type-Moon 2009 April Fools Site":http://tatari.byethost33.com/tmfools/09/index.htm
* "Ufotable 2012 April Fools [i]Sensha Otoko[/i] Movie Site":http://www.ufotable.com/tankman/index.html

title: m'aiq
body:
[i]"M'aiq knows much, tells some. M'aiq knows many things others do not."[/i]

Better known as M'aiq the Liar, a recurring [[khajiit]] male character of [[The Elder Scrolls]] franchise. Initially an obscure NPC in [[the_elder_scrolls_iii:_morrowind|Morrowind]] who, true to his name, gave a litany of false advice, save for an in-game location. Since then, his role has evolved to being an in-game mouthpiece for the developers to poke fun at themselves and the fanbase.

title: lydia_(skyrim)
body: A character and companion in [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim]]. By default, she is a nord woman with [[brown hair|brown]] [[short hair]] with a [[braid]] to the side of it. She is a housecarl who becomes available for the player character to freely hire after completing an early story quest. Despite other followers being obtainable before her availability and her dialogue being shared with any other with the same voice type, her early game attainability, combat viability, and unique sass towards the player has made her memorable among the community.

title: odahviing
body:
Odahviing is a dragon and was an ally of and right-hand dragon to Alduin. The Dragonborn must summon him to an encounter in Whiterun during the main quest. At which point he is captured and bargains for his freedom, swearing his loyalty to the Dragonborn, and taking them too where they can find and confront Alduin.

In the dragon language his name is spelled using the words for Snow/OD, Hunter/AH, and Wing/VIING but some write it as (Winged Snow Hunter).

At some point during the story Odahviing and other dragons loyal to Alduin began to have doubts about Alduin's rule, likely out of fear of losing another war. Which was likely the catalyst to him betraying Alduin to the Dragonborn. After Alduin defeat, he chooses to go his own way and embrace his newfound freedom while swearing his loyalty to the Dragonborn. He does however refuse to restrain himself in the same way as Paarthurnax does, calling his "way of the voice" a form of tyranny.

title: paarthurnax
body:
Paarthurnax is a dragon also called "the Old One" by other dragons, is the leader of the Greybeards. He served as Alduin's lieutenant during the Dragon War, during which he was said to have committed and witnessed unspeakable atrocities against mankind. However, his brother Alduin's claim to godhood caused him to rebel against him, siding with the humans by teaching them how to use the Thu'um.

In the Dragon language his name is spelled using the words for Ambition/PAAR, Overlord/THUR, and Cruelty/NAX

As with all Dragons, the lust for power was innate and still strong within him and if left unchecked, he would surely revert to his old ways. To overcome this, he retired to the peak of the Throat of the World and lived in seclusion so that he could meditate and focus. Although he played a big part in Alduin's eventual defeat, he was not happy about it, as he still considered him his brother and would mourn his passing.

title: alduin
body:
Alduin, aslo known as the World Eater also considered an alternative name of Akatosh (patron god of dragons and time) by some of Tamriel is a dragon and the primary antagonist of [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim]]'s Main Quest. He is considered the "wellspring" of the Nordic pantheon, as well as the harbinger of the apocalypse. He is also described as the "creator of dragon civilization" in one particular text.

In the Dragon Language his name is spelled using the words for Destroyer/AL, Devour/DU, and Master/IN. 

Many dragons refer to Alduin as "the first" while a few even call him Brother. Alduin himself as even called them his children, however the actual familial connection is up for debate.
